result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:33 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Adam P Nero in court for Troy William Rees. Defendant Troy William Rees in court. Court reviews case. ADA Ellenwood received results and filed amended info. Atty Nero waives reading and enters NG plea. ADA Ellenwood has provided all discovery and provided Offer. Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 10:36 AM

filed by Atty Nero requesting to have PSC hearing to be heard specifically at 10:30 AM.  Per EFV on 9/2/22- Approved, JA will send out new notices. bph

* AMENDED * 

- Bond on file

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

10:07 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam P Nero in court for Troy William Rees who appeared by video. Court confirms address of DE. Court notes Information on file. Attys would like to proceed with ARGN today. Atty Nero would like to address testing condition of bond, Atty Ellenwood responds, notes no violations of testing. State takes no position to modifying bond. Court amends bond to reasonable suspicion testing only, no required testing. Atty Nero advises DE as to ARGN; DE and Atty Nero would like to proceed with the ARGN. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Does not demand or revoke speedy trial.  DE to come in and sign new bond, then can return device to JSC. Adjourned: 10:16 am.

Pretrial Assessment Report. arc

by Jesse R - 22R 008698. jaf
*No Bond Posting Notice included in bond envelope. jaf
Status conference on June 29, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 3 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

01:37 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow with Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY: Stephanie Kay Schmidt,  DF:  Troy William Rees appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets STC. Court approves zoom appearance if request is made by Atty. Adjourned  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
